docs.title: SDEC: Blood transfusions
docs.text:
• Book onto medical tracker for the SDEC team to contact.
  • Do not give an arrival time.
  • Ensure ED bloods include 2 × Group & Save (helps quicker requesting of red cells).

docs.title: PE / DVT in pregnancy
docs.text:
• ≤16 weeks gestation: route to SDEC
  • >16 weeks gestation and ≤6 weeks postpartum: via Obstetrics registrar
  • Ensure the patient information leaflet is given (as referenced in the guide).

docs.title: Frailty
docs.text:
• In hours: refer to Frailty (bleep 544) if medical input required; or PT/OT (bleep 290) if therapies only.
  • Out of hours: if patient requires input from these services, refer via Medical Registrar so patient comfort/rest and clerking/prescribing is addressed.
  • If admitted to DAU, the treating clinician is responsible for prescribing regular meds; ensure time-critical meds are prescribed promptly.

docs.title: Infectious Diseases: Suspected TB
docs.text:
• If suspected TB (clinical presentation and/or CXR findings), email referral to uhdb.tbserviceburton@nhs.net
  • Weekdays: TB specialist nurse extension 5050
  • If admission required: use acute medical intake as usual.
  • Reporting radiographers may also refer to the TB service via email if concerned.

docs.title: Infectious Diseases: Rabies vaccine pathway (Rabipur)
docs.text:
• Rabies vaccines (RABIPUR) are kept in the POH cupboard fridge.
  • Administer dose IM.
  • Complete the risk assessment; contact RIgS (UKHSA) on 0330 128 1020.
  • RIgS will take patient details, GP address, and an NHS email to send the completed assessment (attach to records).
  • They will send 2 vials to the patient’s GP and advise dose dates, and replace the used Rabipur.
  • Weekends/Bank Holidays 9am–7pm: contact Colindale Duty Doctor Service via 0208 200 4400 instead of RIgS.
  • Note in guide: UK is not an endemic rabies nation; immunoglobulins not usually given and not held in hospital.

docs.title: Dermatology: photography & IG compliance (out of hours)
docs.text:
• In hours: use V6 to request medical photography.
  • Out of hours options: 1) Place V6 order; patient contacts medical photography next day via switchboard extension 5299 2) Take photos via Outlook (IG compliant) and email uhdb.qhbphotographic@nhs.net with name, NHS number, DOB, urgency, and date taken.
  • Can also be used for safeguarding concerns OOH or transfer needs (e.g. burns).

Emergency Department - QHB

Last Updated: September 2025

Review: Monthly

Authors: Dr S Mistry and Dr B Arnold

****Please do not edit this document – all suggestions / improvements welcomed – please contact Dr S Mistry directly ****

Useful information:

Quick link to QHB telephone directory

ef-estates.uhdb.nhs.uk/Intranet/TelephoneDirectory/directory

Useful numbers – link:

QHB telephone numbers

Virtual Ward:

Telephone number: 01827 308814

Toxbase:

Username: H424 Password: BV449A

Palliative Clinical Nurse Specialists:

01283 566333 or 511511 Ext 5034 / 5748

SDEC:

Blood transfusions:

Book onto medical tracker for SDEC team to contact. Do not give an arrival time. Ensure bloods sent from ED including 2 x G+S as facilitates the quicker requesting of red cells from blood bank.

PE / DVT - Pregnant Patients:

Gestation: 16 weeks and under: to SDEC, over 16 weeks and if 6 weeks or less postpartum: via Obstetrics reg

370_ThromboembolismPregnancy_VTE pathway_CGSupp_2_1_0

Ensure information leaflet given to patient (see attachment in ED survival guide channel O+G folder)

Frailty:

In hours patients can be referred frailty (544) if medical input required, or if therapies only then to PT / OT (290). Out of hours patient requiring input from these services must be referred to the medical registrar to ensure comfort and rest as well as being clerked by the medical team so regular medications are prescribed.

If patients are being admitted to DAU then it is the treating clinicians responsibility to prescribe all the regular medications. Please all ensure time critical medications are prescribed promptly.

Rheumatology:

Please send any referrals to burton referrals (to open a pathway) and the rheumatology secretaries. Provide a summary (copy and pasting V6 notes is fine!) and patient details. This will be reviewed by a QHB rheumatology consultant. Ensure the ED on call consultant is cc'd into the email.

uhdb.bhft.burtonreferrals@nhs.net

rheumatology.secretariesqhb@nhs.net

Dermatology:

Please send an email to the below address. Also complete a V6 referral on Meditech. In orders type 'cons' and then choose the dermatology option. Ensure the ED on call consultant is cc'd into the email.

dhft.burtondermatologyteam@nhs.net

In hours: Use V6 to request medical photography.

If out of hours:

Option 1: Put a V6 order but then tell the patient to contact medical photography the next day. Via switchboard Ext 5299

Option 2: Take your own photos through outlook (This is IG compliant) and send via email to uhdb.qhbphotographic@nhs.net. Ensure name, NHS number and DOB including urgency of upload and date taken.

Medical Photography:

Option 2 can also be used for safeguarding concerns out of hours and if patient requires transfer to tertiary centre eg burns

Neurology:

First seizure referrals will be the most common reason for this. They are booked into a general neurology clinic. Advise patients that there is a long wait time. Please use the email address below. Ensure the ED on call consultant is cc'd into the email.

dhft.referrals@nhs.net

Diabetes referrals:

Diabetes nurses: 07385 375932 (9-5 Monday to Friday, 9-12 Sunday)

Also search ‘diabetes’ under new orders on V6, select ‘CNS adult’

Stroke:

Stroke clinical nurse specialist 07917 650772

Vascular:

Please contact in first instance for vascular concerns in hours

ext 4045 (Monday to Friday 8-4) Mobile 07385 532926

RDH Vascular reg on call 07385 402247

Cardiology - RDH:

Cardiology registrar 07585 966152

(Reg usually until 7pm weekdays and 5pm weekends)

Infectious Diseases:

QHB Internal suspected TB referral pathway:

Patients suspecting to have TB (based on clinical presentation and/or CXR findings, please send an email referral to uhdb.tbserviceburton@nhs.net.

During weekdays, you can contact TB specialist nurse on extension 5050.

If these patients need hospital admission, must go through acute medical intake as usual. (chest physicians)

If the reporting radiographers are worried about CXR findings suspicious of TB, they now will refer to the burton TB service team via email.

QHB Rabies vaccine pathway:

Usually, patients present to ED with h/o dog or wild animal bites when on recent holiday and was advised to get Rabies vaccines when returned to UK.

We keep rabies vaccines (RABIPUR) in our POH cupboard (3-4 vials in the Fridge). We must take one form these and administer the dose as IM injection.

We then need to complete the risk assessment; the assessing clinician should then contact RIgS at UKHSA via 0330 128 1020

RIgS will take details of the patient, their GP surgery address and our NHS email address (to which they will send the completed risk assessment from which needs to be attached to the patient records). They will send 2 vials to the patient's GP surgery and advice which dates they need to have these 2 doses. They will also replace the used Rabipur vaccine from QHB POH cupboard.

Weekends and Bank Holidays 9am – 7pm (Colindale Duty Doctor Service hours) Follow the above process, but instead of contacting RIgS, contact the Colindale Duty Doctor Service via 0208 200 4400.

Note: UK is not an endemic nation for Rabies and so we do not usually give "Immunoglobulins" and so do not have in hour hospital.

Https://derby.koha-ptfs.co.uk/cgi-bin/koha/tracklinks.pl?uri=http://derby.koha-ptfs.co.uk/cgi-bin/koha/opac-retrieve-file.pl?id=af5a8e75795b57828827c85fa63151c2;biblionumber=1914

For paediatric burns patients NCH recommend:

Referrals / Advice:

  1. All referrals will be directed to the plastics doctors on call

  2. If over a weekend or weeknight the burns and plastics nurses will triage referrals on a weekday morning and book appointments as required.

  3. If patients are not required to come to QMC we can provide support and guidance as required

  4. Dressings clinic is open Monday – Friday 8-4pm and is predominately nurse led.

In event of immediately life or limb threatening trauma presenting to QHB, EPIC is to contact the Regional Trauma Desk to activate the appropriate pathway:

Trauma Network Guideline Hyperlink

Major Trauma (Paediatric)

Birmingham Children's Hospital is our local Paediatric Major Trauma Centre.  

ALL children with trauma needing a transfer to the Children’s MTC (Birmingham Children’s Hospital) should be referred via KIDS (Kids Critical Care and Intensive Support). 

Do not phone ED or a Specialty area or the RTD.

KIDS Tel: 0300 200 1100

KIDS will facilitate the call and provide TTL advice when required 

KIDS will be used in a coordination capacity and will not necessarily move the child. If the patient is time critical it will still fall on the local team to transfer
